Package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.handling

Class ExceptionHandlingWebDriverFunctions

java.lang.Object
io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.handling.ExceptionHandlingWebDriverFunctions
public class ExceptionHandlingWebDriverFunctions extends Object
Provides exception handling functions for WebDriver actions.

This class includes utility methods to handle exceptions that may occur during WebDriver operations, such as handling NoSuchElementException when elements are not found.

  • Method Details

    • handleNoSuchElement

      public static Object handleNoSuchElement(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver, WebElementAction webElementAction, Object... args)
      Handles NoSuchElementException by attempting to locate the element within iFrames.

      If an element is not found in the main DOM, this method will search within available iFrames. If found, the specified WebElementAction is performed. If the element is still not found, an error is logged and a NoSuchElementException is thrown.

      Parameters:
      driver - The WebDriver instance.
      webElementAction - The WebElementAction to perform if the element is found.
      args - The arguments, where the first argument must be a By locator.
      Returns:
      The result of the performed action, if successful.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the locator argument is missing or invalid.
      org.openqa.selenium.NoSuchElementException - If the element cannot be found in the main DOM or any iframe.
